title: Who is the weakest 5 gold unit?

replies.body:
I'd argue by far the weakest 5 Star is arguably {{champion:34}} 

Her Ult itself doesn't stun, and healing champions and dashing champions can leave it or just stand in it in most cases while they finish off Anivia's team. Glacial gets a little dodgey itself, as does an Elementalist Golem, but neither are an innate Anivia Strength.

> [{quoted}](name=Illabethe,realm=NA,application-id=RaE1aOE7,discussion-id=mBENNEpE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-08-31T10:53:14.283+0000)
>
> I'd argue by far the weakest 5 Star is arguably {{champion:34}} 
> 
> Her Ult itself doesn't stun, and healing champions and dashing champions can leave it or just stand in it in most cases while they finish off Anivia's team. Glacial gets a little dodgey itself, as does an Elementalist Golem, but neither are an innate Anivia Strength.

Then why "arguably"?

{{champion:34}} by far, she'd even be meh for a tier 4 unit...
She does way to little damage for how small the aoe is and how often units just walk out of it, and while the AS-slow is nice, it's not nearly as powerfull as some hard CCs like Seju or Cho, her hp and aa dps are not great either. 
She really should either br tier 4 with  maybe a small damage buff, or she needs something done, like expanding the area from a 1hex-aoe to 2-hex aoe over the first 2 sec, or increaing her damage with each tick, or make every 3ed AA a frosbite for some magic damage that crits vs targets affected by her ult....
Glacial can make up for a bit of it, but that RNG shit just isn't reliable and Elemental is fine but nothing more right now.

{{champion:21}}  still is wonky, she is very powerfull, but her ult aim sucks and so she's very hit or miss, either beeing usless for 3 sec or totally wrecking a fight.
{{champion:80}}  seems to be a bit overnerfed given that guardians also got a big nerf, but only a bit
{{champion:157}} is ok at best, can be strong with some items or if lvl 2, but still not nearly as strong as kayle, karth and swain, and imo he should be the strongest individual pice given that he can't trigger origin synergies and requires a specific placement that kinda excludes him from guardians aswell as locket and zeke's, so i wouldn't mind some small buffs comming his way.

I know I'm starting to sound like the normal game boards, but please don't buff Yasuo.

His exclusion from guardians comes with the benefit of a much better defensive steroid that has no other asks. Plus he still can benefit from aura items since they reach 2 tiles. And stacking HP items on him is way better than raw damage because of his passive. This isn't league it's TFT, TFT yasuo has no crit effects. He's a bruiser here. What a crazy Convergence we live in, right Kass?

Yasuo is completely fine....and ridiculous in Blademaster comps. He doesn't need buffs at all because on hit items for him are just as broken as gunslingers.

{{champion:157}} really needs level 2 to be useful. Exile scales with stats. I think one problem I see is no one builds health on him. That's how his passive scales, {{item:3748}} to the rescue. 

{{champion:34}} is next, without AP items she does no damage, she doesn't go well with the Glacial typing. Her savior is {{champion:127}} matching her typing meaning you only need these 2 and another elementalist to reach her full potential. Of course then you get rekt by dragons...

{{champion:21}} ults an almost dead target on the side? Congratulations she stunned herself. She also shows up too late for Pirate to be particularly useful, even tho paired with {{champion:41}} and {{champion:104}} she gets a lot of synergy going.

{{champion:80}} will live and die by the strength of his types. If guardian is weak he will be too. Plus he's lacking a lot of cross-synergy with his other units. Still, with {{item:3075}} {{item:3083}} and Dragon up, combined with the fact that (someone tell me if I'm wrong) he still gets Warmogs regen in the air would make him nearly unkillable. 

{{champion:10}} ult is just silly good, even if the champ suffers a bit of an identity crisis. Great synergy with {{champion:86}} + Noble. 

{{champion:50}} I haven't had a lot of experience with but I could see him becoming a true monster if built around. Gunblade + Transform health + Imperial buff = won round. And he's even got demon synergy, which is super strong in general, AND and he shares it with Elise. A simple core of Elise+Darius+Swain and either Shyv+ASol or Jayce+Hextech is a very scary setup. 

{{champion:30}} at level 2 with a deathcap and Sorcerer 1 literally oneshot the enemy backline in the 1v1 fest in a recent game I had. Plus I've been LOVING Phantoms lately. The only downside is his ult has a tendency to get interrupted if he doesn't get a Seraphs and Sorcerer buff...
I've had an exceptionally bad time getting {{champion:34}} to do much of anything.  She pales compared to {{champion:21}} , and they directly compete for the "team-wide damage dump" role.

By far it is Pantheon now. They released him rushed, pushed ?guardian/dragon? on him even though he is neither... and a few days after release they nerfed him into the ground, go look it is a HUGE nerf.

I disagree. 2 Consecutive Wins with him.
People are trying to slot him into high risk high reward teams while other Guardians just don't fit with those comps.

Even with his nerfs, a few items he just nails an entire team with Grievous wounds and a significant burn. That alone changes the next 10 seconds of the match.

Put him on a Noble team with 3 Guardians. That's why he was nerfed and Guardians were nerfed, after all (noble + Guardian = pretty tanky team that's hard to kill). That way his team heals, but the other team doesn't.
Expect this to happen, every time they wanna cross promote they'll stuff a champ out. Even TF is completely forgotten as the first new champ when that should have been a memorable unit.
